page.title: 10BURNS SOUTH OF BARRHEAD
page.content:
Throughout the area there are many {narrow burns}which provide{drainage} for the surrounding land and{feed the {dams and reservoirs.}
The following{wild flowers and plants} can be found along the banks:- dog violet, mosses, speedwell, blackberry, hedge parsley, foxglove, nettles, goose grass, bluebell, rosebay willow herb, grass, chickweed and ribwort plantain.
In the{burn}itself can be found mayfly nymph, water beetles, midge larva, freshwater shrimp, sticklebacks and many others.
These burns often run close to tightly knit{hedges}of beech, hawthorn, holly, and dogrose forming borders to fields and pastureland.
